SEARCH
Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.example.platformerplain.controller

Class MoneyController

java.lang.Object
com.example.platformerplain.controller.MoneyController
public class MoneyController extends Object
Manages the collection and interactions of money items in the game.

This class is responsible for the creation, collection, and management of money items that the player can obtain during the game.

It tracks the money items, detects if the player encounters the money items, and updates the game state accordingly.

  • Method Details

    • addMoney

      public void addMoney(double x, double y)
      Adds a new money item at the specified coordinates.

      The addMoney method creates a new money item at the specified X and Y coordinates and adds it to the list of money items.

      Parameters:
      x - the X coordinate of the new money item
      y - the Y coordinate of the new money item

    • getMoneyItems

      public List<Money> getMoneyItems()
      Returns the list of money items.
      Returns:
      The list of money items.

    • collectMoney

      public int collectMoney(Player player)
      Collects money items that the player collides with.

      The collectMoney method Checks for collisions with the player and money items.

      If a collision is detected, the money item is collected and removed from the game, while the count of collected money items is increase by 1.

      Parameters:
      player - the player character
      Returns:
      The number of money items collected

    • collectMoney

      private void collectMoney(Money money)
      Collects a specific money item and removes it from the game view.
      Parameters:
      money - the money item to collect

    • setPlayerEntity

      public void setPlayerEntity(javafx.scene.image.ImageView playerEntity)
      Sets the player entity to be used for collision detection with money items.

      The playerEntity method updates the player entity used to detect collisions with money items.

      Parameters:
      playerEntity - the visual representation of the player
